frames.text:
<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />The earth was without form and empty. Darkness was upon the surface of the deep. The Spirit of God was moving above the surface of the waters.

<verse number="3" style="v" />God said, "Let there be light," and there was light.

  <verse number="4" style="v" />God saw the light, that it was good. He divided the light from the darkness.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />God called the light "day," and the darkness he called "night." This was evening and morning, the first day.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="6" style="v" />God said, "Let there be an expanse between the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters."

  <verse number="7" style="v" />God made the expanse and divided the waters which were under the expanse from the waters which were above the expanse. It was so.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />God called the expanse "sky." This was evening and morning, the second day.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="9" style="v" />God said, "Let the waters under the sky be gathered together to one place, and let the dry land appear." It was so.

  <verse number="10" style="v" />God called the dry land "earth," and the gathered waters he called "seas." He saw that it was good.

<verse number="11" style="v" />God said, "Let the earth sprout vegetation: plants yielding seed and fruit trees bearing fruit whose seed is in the fruit, each according to its own kind." It was so.

  <verse number="12" style="v" />The earth produced vegetation, plants producing seed after their kind, and trees bearing fruit whose seed was in it, after their kind. God saw that it was good.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />This was evening and morning, the third day.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="14" style="v" />God said, "Let there be lights in the sky to divide the day from the night. And let them be as signs, for seasons, for days and years.

  <verse number="15" style="v" />Let them be lights in the sky to give light upon the earth." It was so.

<verse number="16" style="v" />God made the two great lights, the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night. He made the stars also.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />God set them in the sky to give light upon the earth,

  <verse number="18" style="v" />to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness. God saw that it was good.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />This was evening and morning, the fourth day.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="20" style="v" />God said, "Let the waters swarm with swarms of living creatures, and let birds fly above the earth in the expanse of the sky."

  <verse number="21" style="v" />God created the great sea creatures, as well as every living creature after its kind, creatures that move and with which the waters swarm, and every winged bird after its kind. God saw that it was good.

<verse number="22" style="v" />God blessed them, saying, "Be fruitful and multiply, and fill the waters in the seas. Let birds multiply on the earth."

  <verse number="23" style="v" />This was evening and morning, the fifth day.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="24" style="v" />God said, "Let the earth produce living creatures, each according to its own kind, livestock, creeping things, and beasts of the earth, each according to its own kind." It was so.

  <verse number="25" style="v" />God made the beasts of the earth after their kind, the livestock after their kinds, and everything that creeps upon the ground after its kind. He saw that it was good.

<verse number="26" style="v" />God said, "Let us make man in our image, after our likeness. Let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, over the birds of the sky, over the livestock, over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creeps on the earth."

<note caller="+" style="f">

  <char style="ft">Some ancient copies have: </char>

  <char style="fqa">...Over the livestock, over all the animals of the earth, and over every creeping thing that creeps on the earth. </char>

  <char style="fqb"></char>

</note>

  <verse number="27" style="v" />God created man in his own image. In his own image he created him. Male and female he created them.

<verse number="28" style="v" />God blessed them and said to them, "Be fruitful, and multiply. Fill the earth, and subdue it. Have dominion over the fish of the sea, over the birds of the sky, and over every living thing that moves upon the earth."

  <verse number="29" style="v" />God said, "See, I have given you every plant yielding seed which is upon the surface of all the earth, and every tree with fruit which has seed in it. They will be food to you.

<verse number="30" style="v" />To every beast of the earth, to every bird of the heavens, and to everything that creeps upon the earth, and to every creature that has the breath of life I have given every green plant for food." It was so.

  <verse number="31" style="v" />God saw everything that he had made. Behold, it was very good. This was evening and morning, the sixth day.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Then the heavens and the earth were finished, and all the living things that filled them.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />On the seventh day God came to the end of his work which he had done, and so he rested on the seventh day from all his work.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />God blessed the seventh day and sanctified it, because in it he rested from all his work which he had done in his creation.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="4" style="v" />These were the events concerning the heavens and the earth, when they were created, on the day that Yahweh God made the earth and the heavens.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />No bush of the field was yet in the earth, and no plant of the field had yet sprouted, for Yahweh God had not caused it to rain upon the earth, and there was no man to cultivate the ground.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />But a mist went up from the earth and watered the whole surface of the ground.

<verse number="7" style="v" />Yahweh God formed man from the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life, and man became a living being.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />Yahweh God planted a garden eastward, in Eden, and there he put the man whom he had formed.

<verse number="9" style="v" />Out of the ground Yahweh God made every tree to grow that is pleasant to the sight and good for food. This included the tree of life that was in the midst of the garden, and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.

  <verse number="10" style="v" />A river went out of Eden to water the garden. From there it divided and became four rivers.

<verse number="11" style="v" />The name of the first is Pishon. It is the one which flows throughout the whole land of Havilah, where there is gold.

  <verse number="12" style="v" />The gold of that land is good. There are also bdellium and the onyx stone.

<verse number="13" style="v" />The name of the second river is Gihon. This one flows throughout the whole land of Cush.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />The name of the third river is Tigris, which flows east of Asshur. The fourth river is the Euphrates.

<verse number="15" style="v" />Yahweh God took the man and put him into the garden of Eden to work it and to maintain it.

  <verse number="16" style="v" />Yahweh God commanded the man, saying, "From every tree in the garden you may freely eat.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />But from the tree of the knowledge of good and evil you may not eat, for on the day that you eat from it, you will surely die."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="18" style="v" />Then Yahweh God said, "It is not good that the man should be alone. I will make him a helper corresponding to him."

  <verse number="19" style="v" />Out of the ground Yahweh God formed every animal of the field and every bird of the sky. Then he brought them to the man to see what he would call them. Whatever the man called each living creature, that was its name.

  <verse number="20" style="v" />The man gave names to all the livestock, to all the birds of the sky, and to every beast of the field. But for the man himself there was found no helper corresponding to him.

<verse number="21" style="v" />Yahweh God caused a deep sleep to fall upon the man, so the man slept. Yahweh God took one of his ribs and closed up the flesh where he took the rib.

  <verse number="22" style="v" />With the rib that Yahweh God had taken from the man, he made a woman and brought her to the man.

  <verse number="23" style="v" />The man said, </para>

<para style="q1">"This time, this one is bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh. </para>

<para style="q1">She will be called 'woman,' because she was taken out of man."

<verse number="24" style="v" />Therefore a man will leave his father and his mother, he will be united to his wife, and they will become one flesh.

<verse number="25" style="v" />They were both naked, the man and his wife, but were not ashamed.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Now the serpent was more shrewd than any other beast of the field which Yahweh God had made. He said to the woman, "Has God really said, 'You must not eat from any tree of the garden'?"

  <verse number="2" style="v" />The woman said to the serpent, "We may eat the fruit from the trees of the garden,

  <verse number="3" style="v" />but concerning the fruit of the tree which is in the middle of the garden, God said, 'You may not eat it, nor may you touch it, or you will die.'"

<verse number="4" style="v" />The serpent said to the woman, "You will surely not die.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />For God knows that the day you eat it your eyes will be opened, and you will be like God, knowing good and evil."

  <verse number="6" style="v" />And when the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was a delight to the eyes, and that the tree was desirable to make one wise, she took some of its fruit and ate it. And she gave some also to her husband who was with her, and he ate it.

<verse number="7" style="v" />The eyes of both of them were opened, and they knew that they were naked. They sewed fig leaves together and made coverings for themselves.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />They heard the sound of Yahweh God walking in the garden in the cool of the day, so the man and his wife hid themselves from the presence of Yahweh God among the trees of the garden.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="9" style="v" />Yahweh God called to the man and said to him, "Where are you?"

  <verse number="10" style="v" />The man said, "I heard you in the garden, and I was afraid, because I was naked. So I hid myself."

  <verse number="11" style="v" />God said, "Who told you that you were naked? Have you eaten from the tree that I commanded you not to eat from?"

<verse number="12" style="v" />The man said, "The woman whom you gave to be with me, she gave me fruit from the tree, and I ate it."

  <verse number="13" style="v" />Yahweh God said to the woman, "What is this you have done?" The woman said, "The serpent deceived me, and I ate."

<verse number="14" style="v" />Yahweh God said to the serpent, </para>

<para style="q1">"Because you have done this, </para>

<para style="q1">cursed are you alone among all the livestock </para>

<para style="q1">and all the beasts of the field. </para>

<para style="q1">It is on your belly that you will go, </para>

<para style="q1">and it is dust that you will eat all the days of your life.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="15" style="v" />I will put hostility between you and the woman, </para>

<para style="q1">and between your seed and her seed. </para>

<para style="q1">He will bruise your head, and you will bruise his heel."

<verse number="16" style="v" />To the woman he said, </para>

<para style="q1">"I will greatly multiply your pain in having children; </para>

<para style="q1">it is in pain that you will give birth to children.</para>

<para style="q1">Your desire will be for your husband, but he will rule over you."

<verse number="17" style="v" />To Adam he said, </para>

<para style="q1">"Because you have listened to the voice of your wife, </para>

<para style="q1">and have eaten from the tree, concerning which I commanded you, </para>

<para style="q1">saying, 'You may not eat from it,' </para>

<para style="q1">cursed is the ground because of you; </para>

<para style="q1">in painful toil you will eat from it all the days of your life. </para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="18" style="v" />It will produce thorns and thistles for you, </para>

<para style="q1">and you will eat the plants of the field.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="19" style="v" />By the sweat of your face you will eat bread,</para>

<para style="q1">until you return to the ground, for out of it you were taken. </para>

<para style="q1">For dust you are, and to dust you will return."

<verse number="20" style="v" />The man called his wife's name Eve because she was the mother of all the living.

<verse number="21" style="v" />Yahweh God made for Adam and for his wife garments of skins and clothed them.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="22" style="v" />Yahweh God said, "Now the man has become like one of us, knowing good and evil. So now he must not be allowed to reach out with his hand, take from the tree of life, eat it, and live forever."

  <verse number="23" style="v" />Therefore Yahweh God sent him out from the garden of Eden, to cultivate the ground from which he had been taken.

  <verse number="24" style="v" />So God drove the man out of the garden, and he placed cherubim at the east of the garden of Eden, and a flaming sword that turned every way, in order to guard the way to the tree of life.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />The man slept with Eve his wife. She conceived and gave birth to Cain. She said, "I have produced a man with Yahweh's help."

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Then she gave birth to his brother Abel. Now Abel became a shepherd, but Cain cultivated the soil.

<verse number="3" style="v" />It came about that in the course of time Cain brought some of the fruit of the ground as an offering to Yahweh.

  <verse number="4" style="v" />As for Abel, he brought some of the firstborn of his flock and some of the fat. Yahweh accepted Abel and his offering,

  <verse number="5" style="v" />but Cain and his offering he did not accept. So Cain was very angry, and he scowled.

<verse number="6" style="v" />Yahweh said to Cain, "Why are you angry and why are you scowling?

  <verse number="7" style="v" />If you do what is right, will you not be accepted? But if you do not do what is right, sin crouches at the door and desires to control you, but you must rule over it."

<verse number="8" style="v" />Cain spoke to Abel his brother. It came about that while they were in the fields, Cain rose up against Abel his brother and killed him.

<note caller="+" style="f">

  <char style="ft">The best ancient copies read in this way. However, some old translations and some modern translations read, </char>

  <char style="fqa">Cain said to Abel his brother, "Let us go into the fields." It came about that while they were in the fields, Cain rose up against Abel his brother and killed him. </char>

</note></para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="9" style="v" />Then Yahweh said to Cain, "Where is Abel your brother?" He said, "I do not know. Am I my brother's keeper?"

<verse number="10" style="v" />Yahweh said, "What have you done? Your brother's blood is calling out to me from the ground.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />Now cursed are you from the ground, which has opened its mouth to receive your brother's blood from your hand.

  <verse number="12" style="v" />When you cultivate the ground, from now on it will not yield to you its strength. A fugitive and a wanderer you will be in the earth."

<verse number="13" style="v" />Cain said to Yahweh, "My punishment is greater than I can bear.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />Indeed, you have driven me out this day from this ground, and I will be hidden from your face. I will be a fugitive and a wanderer in the earth, and whoever finds me will kill me."

  <verse number="15" style="v" />Yahweh said to him, "If anyone kills Cain, vengeance will be taken on him sevenfold." Then Yahweh put a mark on Cain, so that if anyone found him, that person would not attack him.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="16" style="v" />So Cain went out from the presence of Yahweh and lived in the land of Nod, on the east of Eden.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />Cain slept with his wife and she conceived. She gave birth to Enoch. He built a city and named it after his son Enoch.

<verse number="18" style="v" />To Enoch was born Irad. Irad became the father of Mehujael. Mehujael became the father of Methushael. Methushael became the father of Lamech.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />Lamech took for himself two wives: the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other was Zillah.

<verse number="20" style="v" />Adah gave birth to Jabal. He was the father of those who lived in tents who have livestock.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />His brother's name was Jubal. He was the father of those who play the harp and pipe.

  <verse number="22" style="v" />As for Zillah, she bore Tubal Cain, the forger of tools of bronze and iron. The sister of Tubal Cain was Naamah.

<verse number="23" style="v" />Lamech said to his wives, </para>

<para style="q1">"Adah and Zillah, listen to my voice; you wives of Lamech, listen to what I say.</para>

<para style="q1">For I have killed a man for wounding me, a young man for bruising me.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="24" style="v" />If Cain is avenged seven times, then Lamech will be avenged seventy-seven times."

<verse number="25" style="v" />Adam slept with his wife again, and she bore another son. She called his name Seth and said, "God has given me another son in the place of Abel, for Cain killed him."

<verse number="26" style="v" />A son was born to Seth and he called his name Enosh. At that time people began to call on the name of Yahweh.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />This is the record of the descendants of Adam. On the day that God created mankind, he made them in his own likeness.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Male and female he created them. He blessed them and named them mankind when they were created.

<verse number="3" style="v" />When Adam had lived 130 years, he became the father of a son in his own likeness, after his image, and he called his name Seth.

  <verse number="4" style="v" />After Adam became the father of Seth, he lived eight hundred years. He became the father of more sons and daughters.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Adam lived 930 years, and then he died.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="6" style="v" />When Seth had lived 105 years, he became the father of Enosh.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />After he became the father of Enosh, he lived 807 years and became the father of more sons and daughters.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />Seth lived 912 years, and then he died.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="9" style="v" />When Enosh had lived ninety years, he became the father of Kenan.

  <verse number="10" style="v" />After he became the father of Kenan, Enosh lived 815 years. He became the father of more sons and daughters.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />Enosh lived 905 years, and then he died.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="12" style="v" />When Kenan had lived seventy years, he became the father of Mahalalel.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />After he became the father of Mahalalel, Kenan lived 840 years. He became the father of more sons and daughters.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />Kenan lived 910 years, and then he died.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="15" style="v" />When Mahalalel had lived sixty-five years, he became the father of Jared.

  <verse number="16" style="v" />After he became the father of Jared, Mahalalel lived 830 years. He became the father of more sons and daughters.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />Mahalalel lived 895 years, and then he died.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="18" style="v" />When Jared had lived 162 years, he became the father of Enoch.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />After he became the father of Enoch, Jared lived eight hundred years. He became the father of more sons and daughters.

  <verse number="20" style="v" />Jared lived 962 years, and then he died.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="21" style="v" />When Enoch had lived sixty-five years, he became the father of Methuselah.

  <verse number="22" style="v" />Enoch walked with God three hundred years after he became the father of Methuselah. He became the father of more sons and daughters.

  <verse number="23" style="v" />Enoch lived 365 years.

  <verse number="24" style="v" />Enoch walked with God, and then he was gone, for God took him.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="25" style="v" />When Methuselah had lived 187 years, he became the father of Lamech.

  <verse number="26" style="v" />After he became the father of Lamech, Methuselah lived 782 years. He became the father of more sons and daughters.

  <verse number="27" style="v" />Methuselah lived 969 years. Then he died.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="28" style="v" />When Lamech had lived 182 years, he became the father of a son.

  <verse number="29" style="v" />He called his name Noah, saying, "This one will give us rest from our work and from the toil of our hands, which we must do because of the ground that Yahweh has cursed."

<verse number="30" style="v" />Lamech lived 595 years after he became the father of Noah. He became the father of more sons and daughters.

  <verse number="31" style="v" />Lamech lived 777 years. Then he died.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="32" style="v" />After Noah had lived five hundred years, he became the father of Shem, Ham, and Japheth.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />It came about when mankind began to multiply on the earth and daughters were born to them,

  <verse number="2" style="v" />that the sons of God saw that the daughters of mankind were attractive. They took for themselves wives, any of them that they chose.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />Yahweh said, "My spirit will not remain in mankind forever, for they are flesh. They will live 120 years."

<verse number="4" style="v" />Giants were on the earth in those days, and also afterward. This happened when the sons of God married daughters of men, and they had children with them. These were the mighty men of old, men of renown. </para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Yahweh saw that the wickedness of mankind was great in the earth, and that every inclination of the thoughts of their hearts was only evil continually.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Yahweh regretted that he had made mankind on the earth, and it grieved him to his heart.

<verse number="7" style="v" />So Yahweh said, "I will wipe away mankind whom I have created from the surface of the earth; both mankind and the larger animals, and creeping things and birds of the heavens, for I am sorry that I have made them."

  <verse number="8" style="v" />But Noah found favor in the eyes of Yahweh.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="9" style="v" />These were the events concerning Noah. Noah was a righteous man, and blameless among the people of his time. Noah walked with God.

  <verse number="10" style="v" />Noah became the father of three sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

<verse number="11" style="v" />The earth was corrupt before God, and it was filled with violence.

  <verse number="12" style="v" />God saw the earth; behold, it was corrupt, for all flesh had corrupted their way upon the earth.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="13" style="v" />God said to Noah, "I can see that it is time to put an end to all flesh, for the earth is filled with violence through them. Indeed, I will destroy them with the earth.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />Make for yourself an ark of cypress wood. Make rooms in the ark, and cover it with pitch within and without.

  <verse number="15" style="v" />This is how you will make it: the length of the ark three hundred cubits, the breadth of it fifty cubits, and the height of it thirty cubits.

<verse number="16" style="v" />Make a roof for the ark, and finish it at a cubit from the top of the side. Place a door in the side of the ark and make a lower, a second, and a third deck.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />Listen, I am about to bring the flood of waters upon the earth, to destroy all flesh that has in it the breath of life from under heaven. Everything that is on the earth will die.

<verse number="18" style="v" />But I will establish my covenant with you. You will come into the ark, you, and your sons, and your wife, and your sons' wives with you.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />Of every living creature of all flesh, two of every kind you must bring into the ark, to keep them alive with you, both male and female.

<verse number="20" style="v" />Of the birds after their kind, and of the larger animals after their kind, of every creeping thing of the ground after its kind, two of every sort will come to you, to keep them alive.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />Gather for yourself every kind of food that is eaten and store it, so that it will be food for you and for them."

  <verse number="22" style="v" />So Noah did this. According to all that God commanded him, so he did.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Yahweh said to Noah, "Come, you and all your household, into the ark, for I have seen that you are righteous before me in this generation.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Of every clean animal you will bring with you seven males and seven females. And of the animals that are not clean, bring two, the male and his mate.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />Also of the birds of the sky, bring seven males and seven females, to preserve their offspring upon the surface of all the earth.

<verse number="4" style="v" />For in seven days I will cause it to rain upon the earth for forty days and forty nights. I will destroy from off the surface of the ground every living thing that I have made."

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Noah did all that Yahweh commanded him.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Noah was six hundred years old when the flood came upon the earth.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />Noah, his sons, his wife, and his sons' wives went into the ark together because of the waters of the flood.

<verse number="8" style="v" />Clean animals and unclean animals, birds, and everything that creeps upon the ground,

  <verse number="9" style="v" />two by two, male and female, came to Noah and went into the ark, just as God had commanded Noah.

  <verse number="10" style="v" />It came about that after the seven days, the water of the flood came upon the earth.

<verse number="11" style="v" />In the six hundredth year of Noah's life, in the second month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on the same day, all the fountains of the great deep burst open, and the windows of heaven were opened.

  <verse number="12" style="v" />The rain began and fell on the earth for forty days and forty nights.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="13" style="v" />On that very same day Noah and his sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth, and Noah's wife, and the three wives of his sons with them, entered into the ark.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />They entered along with each wild animal according to its kind, and each sort of livestock according to its kind, and each creeping thing that creeps upon the earth according to its kind, and every sort of bird according to its kind, each kind of creature with wings.

<verse number="15" style="v" />Two of all flesh in which was the breath of life came to Noah and entered into the ark.

  <verse number="16" style="v" />The animals that went in were male and female of all flesh; they entered in just as God had commanded him. Then Yahweh shut the door after them.

<verse number="17" style="v" />Then the flood came upon the earth for forty days, and the water increased and lifted up the ark. It rose up from upon the earth.

  <verse number="18" style="v" />The water came in torrents and greatly increased upon the earth, and the ark floated upon the surface of the water.

<verse number="19" style="v" />The waters forced themselves higher and higher on the earth. They completely covered all the high mountains that were under the whole heaven.

  <verse number="20" style="v" />The waters rose fifteen cubits above the tops of the mountains.

<verse number="21" style="v" />All living beings that moved upon the earth died: the birds, the livestock, the wild animals, all the swarming creatures that swarmed upon the earth, and all mankind.

  <verse number="22" style="v" />All beings in whose nostrils was the breath of the spirit of life, all those of the dry land, died.

<verse number="23" style="v" />So every living thing that was on the surface of the earth was wiped out, from mankind to the larger animals, to creeping things, and to birds of the sky. They were all destroyed from the earth. Only Noah and those with him in the ark were left.

  <verse number="24" style="v" />The water dominated the earth for a hundred and fifty days.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />God considered Noah, all the wild animals, and all the livestock that were with him in the ark. God made a wind blow over the earth, and the water started to recede.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />The fountains of the deep and the windows of heaven were closed, and it stopped raining.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />The flood waters receded from off the earth continually. And after the end of a hundred and fifty days, the water had decreased considerably.

<verse number="4" style="v" />The ark came to rest in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, upon the mountains of Ararat.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />The water continued to recede until the tenth month. On the first day of the month, the tops of the mountains appeared.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="6" style="v" />It came about after forty days that Noah opened the window of the ark which he had made.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />He sent out a raven and it flew back and forth until the water was dried up from the earth.

<verse number="8" style="v" />Then he sent out a dove to see if the water had receded from the surface of the ground, 

  <verse number="9" style="v" />but the dove found no place to rest her foot, and she returned to him in the ark, for the water was still covering the whole earth. He reached out with his hand, and took and brought her into the ark with him.

<verse number="10" style="v" />He waited another seven days and again he sent out the dove from the ark.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />The dove returned to him in the evening. Look! In her mouth was a freshly plucked olive leaf. So Noah knew that the water had subsided from off the earth.

  <verse number="12" style="v" />He waited another seven days, and sent out the dove again. She did not return again to him.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="13" style="v" />It came about in the six hundred and first year, in the first month, on the first day of the month, that the waters were dried up from off the earth. Noah removed the covering of the ark, looked out, and saw that, behold, the surface of the ground was dry.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />In the second month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month, the earth was dry.

<verse number="15" style="v" />God said to Noah,

  <verse number="16" style="v" />"Go out of the ark, you, your wife, your sons, and your sons' wives with you.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />Take out with you every living creature of all flesh that is with you, including the birds, the livestock, and every creeping thing that creeps upon the earth, so that they may abound throughout the earth, be fruitful, and multiply upon the earth."

<verse number="18" style="v" />So Noah went out with his sons, his wife, and his sons' wives with him.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />Every living creature, every creeping thing, and every bird, everything that moves on the earth, according to their families, left the ark.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="20" style="v" />Noah built an altar to Yahweh. He took some of the clean animals and some of the clean birds, and offered burnt offerings on the altar.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />Yahweh smelled the pleasing aroma and said in his heart, "I will not again curse the ground because of mankind, even though the inclination of their hearts is evil from childhood. Nor will I again destroy everything living, as I have done.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="22" style="v" />While the earth remains, seed time and harvest, cold and heat, </para>

<para style="q1">summer and winter, and day and night will not cease."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Then God blessed Noah and his sons, and said to them, "Be fruitful, multiply, and fill the earth.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />The fear of you and the dread of you will be upon every living animal on the earth, upon every bird of the sky, upon everything that goes low on the ground, and upon all the fish of the sea. They are given into your hand.

<verse number="3" style="v" />Every moving thing that lives will be food for you. Just as I gave you the green plants, I now give you everything.

  <verse number="4" style="v" />But you must not eat meat with its life—that is its blood—in it.

<verse number="5" style="v" />But for your blood, the life that is in your blood, I will require payment. From the hand of every animal I will require it. From the hand of any man, that is, from the hand of one who has murdered his brother, I will require an accounting for the life of that man.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="6" style="v" />Whoever sheds man's blood, by man will his blood be shed, </para>

<para style="q1">for it was in the image of God that he made man.

<verse number="7" style="v" />As for you, be fruitful and multiply, spread throughout the earth and multiply on it."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="8" style="v" />Then God spoke to Noah and to his sons with him, saying,

  <verse number="9" style="v" />"As for me, listen! I am going to establish my covenant with you and with your descendants after you,

  <verse number="10" style="v" />and with every living creature that is with you, with the birds, the livestock, and every creature of the earth with you, from all that came out of the ark, to every living creature on the earth.

<verse number="11" style="v" />I hereby establish my covenant with you, that never again will all flesh be destroyed by the waters of a flood. Never again will there be a flood to destroy the earth."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="12" style="v" />God said, "This is the sign of the covenant which I am making between me and you and every living creature that is with you, for all future generations:

  <verse number="13" style="v" />I have set my rainbow in the cloud, and it will be the sign of the covenant between me and the earth.

<verse number="14" style="v" />It will come about when I bring a cloud over the earth and the rainbow is seen in the cloud,

  <verse number="15" style="v" />then I will call to mind my covenant, which is between me and you and every living creature of all flesh. The waters will never again become a flood to destroy all flesh.

<verse number="16" style="v" />The rainbow will be in the clouds and I will see it, in order to commemorate the everlasting covenant between God and every living creature of all flesh that is on the earth."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="17" style="v" />Then God said to Noah, "This is the sign of the covenant that I have established between me and all flesh that is on the earth."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="18" style="v" />The sons of Noah that came out of the ark were Shem, Ham, and Japheth. And Ham was the father of Canaan.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />These three were the sons of Noah, and from these the whole earth was populated.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="20" style="v" />Noah began to be a farmer, and he planted a vineyard.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />He drank some of the wine and became drunk. He was lying uncovered in his tent.

<verse number="22" style="v" />Then Ham, the father of Canaan, saw the nakedness of his father and told his two brothers outside.

  <verse number="23" style="v" />So Shem and Japheth took a garment and laid it upon both their shoulders, and walked backwards and covered the nakedness of their father. Their faces were turned the other way, so they did not see their father's nakedness.

<verse number="24" style="v" />When Noah awoke from his drunkenness, he learned what his youngest son had done to him.

  <verse number="25" style="v" />So he said,</para>

<para style="q1">"Cursed be Canaan. May he be a servant to his brothers' servants."

<verse number="26" style="v" />He also said,</para>

<para style="q1">"May Yahweh, the God of Shem, be blessed, and may Canaan be his servant.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="27" style="v" />May God enlarge Japheth, and let him make his home in the tents of Shem. May Canaan be his servant."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="28" style="v" />After the flood, Noah lived three hundred fifty years.

  <verse number="29" style="v" />All the days of Noah were nine hundred fifty years, and then he died.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />These were the descendants of the sons of Noah, that is, Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Sons were born to them after the flood.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="2" style="v" />The sons of Japheth were Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />The sons of Gomer were Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.

  <verse number="4" style="v" />The sons of Javan were Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />From these the coastland peoples separated and went into their lands, every one with its own language, according to their clans, by their nations.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="6" style="v" />The sons of Ham were Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />The sons of Cush were Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabteca. The sons of Raamah were Sheba and Dedan.

<verse number="8" style="v" />Cush became the father of Nimrod, who was the first conqueror on the earth.

  <verse number="9" style="v" />He was a mighty hunter before Yahweh. That is why it is said, "Like Nimrod, a mighty hunter before Yahweh."

  <verse number="10" style="v" />The first centers of his kingdom were Babel, Erech, Accad, and Calneh, in the land of Shinar.

<verse number="11" style="v" />Out of that land he went to Assyria and built Nineveh, Rehoboth Ir, Calah,

  <verse number="12" style="v" />and Resen, which was between Nineveh and Calah. It was a large city.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="13" style="v" />Mizraim became the father of the Ludites, the Anamites, the Lehabites, the Naphtuhites,

  <verse number="14" style="v" />the Pathrusites, the Casluhites (from whom the Philistines came), and the Caphtorites.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="15" style="v" />Canaan became the father of Sidon, his firstborn, and of Heth,

  <verse number="16" style="v" />also of the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,

  <verse number="17" style="v" />the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites,

  <verse number="18" style="v" />the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites. Afterward the clans of the Canaanites spread out.

<verse number="19" style="v" />The border of the Canaanites was from Sidon, in the direction of Gerar, as far as Gaza, and as one goes toward Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim, as far as Lasha.

  <verse number="20" style="v" />These were the sons of Ham, by their clans, by their languages, in their lands, and in their nations.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="21" style="v" />Sons also were born to Shem, the older brother of Japheth. Shem was also the ancestor of all the people of Eber.

  <verse number="22" style="v" />The sons of Shem were Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, and Aram.

  <verse number="23" style="v" />The sons of Aram were Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech.

<verse number="24" style="v" />Arpachshad became the father of Shelah, and Shelah became the father of Eber.

  <verse number="25" style="v" />Eber had two sons. The name of the one was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided. His brother's name was Joktan.

<verse number="26" style="v" />Joktan became the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,

  <verse number="27" style="v" />Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,

  <verse number="28" style="v" />Obal, Abimael, Sheba,

  <verse number="29" style="v" />Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.

<verse number="30" style="v" />Their territory was from Mesha, all the way to Sephar, the mountain of the east.

  <verse number="31" style="v" />These were the sons of Shem, according to their clans and their languages, in their lands, according to their nations.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="32" style="v" />These were the clans of the sons of Noah, according to their genealogies, by their nations. From these the nations separated and went over the earth after the flood.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Now the whole earth used one language and had the same words. 

  <verse number="2" style="v" />As they journeyed in the east, they found a plain in the land of Shinar and they settled there.

<verse number="3" style="v" />They said to one another, "Come, let us make bricks and bake them thoroughly." They had brick instead of stone and tar as mortar.

  <verse number="4" style="v" />They said, "Come, let us build ourselves a city and a tower whose top will reach to the sky, and let us make a name for ourselves. If we do not, we will be scattered across the surface of the whole earth."

<verse number="5" style="v" />So Yahweh came down to see the city and the tower which the descendants of Adam had built.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Yahweh said, "Look, they are one people with the same language, and they are beginning to do this! Soon nothing that they intend to do will be impossible for them.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />Come, let us go down and confuse their language there, so that they may not understand each other."

<verse number="8" style="v" />So Yahweh scattered them from there across the surface of all the earth and they stopped building the city.

  <verse number="9" style="v" />Therefore, its name was called Babel, because there Yahweh confused the language of the whole earth and from there Yahweh scattered them abroad over the surface of all the earth.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="10" style="v" />These were the descendants of Shem. Shem was a hundred years old, and he became the father of Arpachshad two years after the flood.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />Shem lived five hundred years after he became the father of Arpachshad. He also became the father of other sons and daughters.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="12" style="v" />When Arpachshad had lived thirty-five years, he became the father of Shelah.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />Arpachshad lived 403 years after he became the father of Shelah. He also became the father of other sons and daughters.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="14" style="v" />When Shelah had lived thirty years, he became the father of Eber.

  <verse number="15" style="v" />Shelah lived 403 years after he became the father of Eber. He also became the father of other sons and daughters.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="16" style="v" />When Eber had lived thirty-four years, he became the father of Peleg.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />Eber lived 430 years after he became the father of Peleg. He also became the father of other sons and daughters.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="18" style="v" />When Peleg had lived thirty years, he became the father of Reu.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />Peleg lived 209 years after he became the father of Reu. He also became the father of other sons and daughters.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="20" style="v" />When Reu had lived thirty-two years, he became the father of Serug.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />Reu lived 207 years after he became the father of Serug. He also became the father of other sons and daughters.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="22" style="v" />When Serug had lived thirty years, he became the father of Nahor.

  <verse number="23" style="v" />Serug lived two hundred years after he became the father of Nahor. He also became the father of other sons and daughters.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="24" style="v" />When Nahor had live twenty-nine years, he became the father of Terah.

  <verse number="25" style="v" />Nahor lived 119 years after he became the father of Terah. He also became the father of other sons and daughters.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="26" style="v" />After Terah had lived seventy years, he became the father of Abram, Nahor, and Haran.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="27" style="v" />Now these were the descendants of Terah. Terah became the father of Abram, Nahor, and Haran, and Haran became the father of Lot.

  <verse number="28" style="v" />Haran died in the presence of his father Terah in the land of his birth, in Ur of the Chaldeans.

<verse number="29" style="v" />Abram and Nahor took wives. The name of Abram's wife was Sarai and the name of Nahor's wife was Milcah, a daughter of Haran, who was the father of Milcah and Iscah.

  <verse number="30" style="v" />Now Sarai was barren; she had no child.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="31" style="v" />Terah took Abram his son, Lot the son of his son Haran, and Sarai his daughter-in-law, his son Abram's wife, and together they left Ur of the Chaldeans, to go into the land of Canaan. But they came to Haran and stayed there.

  <verse number="32" style="v" />Terah lived 205 years and then died in Haran.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Now Yahweh said to Abram, "Go from your country, and from your relatives, and from your father's household, to the land that I will show you.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />I will make of you a great nation, and I will bless you, and make your name great, and you will be a blessing.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />I will bless those who bless you, but whoever dishonors you I will curse. Through you will all the families of the earth be blessed."

<verse number="4" style="v" />So Abram went, as Yahweh had told him to do, and Lot went with him. Abram was seventy-five years old when he left Haran.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Abram took Sarai, his wife, Lot, his brother's son, all their possessions that they had accumulated, and the people that they had acquired in Haran. They left to go into the land of Canaan, and came to the land of Canaan.

<verse number="6" style="v" />Abram passed through the land as far as Shechem, to the oak of Moreh. At that time the Canaanites lived in the land.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />Yahweh appeared to Abram, and said, "To your descendants I will give this land." So there Abram built an altar to Yahweh, who had appeared to him.

<verse number="8" style="v" />From there he moved to the hill country to the east of Bethel, where he pitched his tent, with Bethel to the west and Ai to the east. There he built an altar to Yahweh and called on the name of Yahweh.

  <verse number="9" style="v" />Then Abram continued journeying, going toward the Negev.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="10" style="v" />There was a famine in the land, so Abram went down into Egypt to stay, for the famine was severe in the land.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />When he was about to enter into Egypt, he said to Sarai his wife, "See here, I know that you are a beautiful woman.

  <verse number="12" style="v" />When the Egyptians see you they will say, 'This is his wife,' and they will kill me, but they will keep you alive.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />Say that you are my sister, so that it may be well with me because of you, and so that my life will be spared because of you."

<verse number="14" style="v" />It came about that when Abram entered into Egypt, the Egyptians saw that Sarai was very beautiful.

  <verse number="15" style="v" />The princes of Pharaoh saw her, and praised her to Pharaoh, and the woman was taken into Pharaoh's household.

  <verse number="16" style="v" />Pharaoh treated Abram well for her sake, and gave him sheep, oxen, male donkeys, male servants, female servants, female donkeys, and camels.

<verse number="17" style="v" />Then Yahweh afflicted Pharaoh and his house with great plagues because of Sarai, Abram's wife.

  <verse number="18" style="v" />Pharaoh summoned Abram, and said, "What is this that you have done to me? Why did you not tell me that she was your wife?

  <verse number="19" style="v" />Why did you say, 'She is my sister,' so that I took her to be my wife? Now therefore, here is your wife. Take her, and go your way."

  <verse number="20" style="v" />Then Pharaoh gave orders to his men concerning him, and they sent him away, along with his wife and all that he had.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />So Abram went up from Egypt and went into the Negev, he, his wife, and all that he had. Lot also went with them.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Now Abram was very rich in animals, in silver, and in gold.

<verse number="3" style="v" />He continued on his journey from the Negev to Bethel, to the place where his tent had been before, between Bethel and Ai.

  <verse number="4" style="v" />He went to the place where the altar was that he had built previously. Here he called on the name of Yahweh.

<verse number="5" style="v" />Now Lot, who was traveling with Abram, also had flocks, herds, and tents.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />The land was not able to support them both living close together, because their possessions were very many, so that they could not stay together.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />Also, there was a dispute between the herdsmen of Abram's animals and the herdsmen of Lot's animals. The Canaanites and the Perizzites were living in the land at that time.

<verse number="8" style="v" />So Abram said to Lot, "Let there be no strife between you and me, and between your herdsmen and my herdsmen; after all, we are family.

  <verse number="9" style="v" />Is not the whole land before you? Go ahead and separate yourself from me. If you go to the left, then I will go to the right. Or if you go to the right, then I will go to the left."

<verse number="10" style="v" />So Lot looked around, and saw that the whole plain of the Jordan was well watered everywhere all the way to Zoar, like the garden of Yahweh, like the land of Egypt. This was before Yahweh destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />So Lot chose for himself all the plain of the Jordan and traveled east, and the relatives separated from each other.

<verse number="12" style="v" />Abram lived in the land of Canaan, and Lot lived among the cities of the plain. He set up his tents as far away as Sodom.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />Now the men of Sodom were very wicked sinners against Yahweh.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="14" style="v" />Yahweh said to Abram after Lot had departed from him, "Look from the place where you are standing to the north, south, east, and west.

  <verse number="15" style="v" />All this land which you see, I will give to you and to your descendants forever.

<verse number="16" style="v" />And I will make your descendants as abundant as the dust of the earth, so that if a man could count the dust of the earth, then your descendants could also be counted.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />Arise, walk through the length and breadth of the land, for I will give it to you."

  <verse number="18" style="v" />So Abram picked up his tent, and came and lived by the oaks of Mamre, which are in Hebron, and there built an altar to Yahweh.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />It came about in the days of Amraphel, king of Shinar, Arioch, king of Ellasar, Chedorlaomer, king of Elam, and Tidal, king of Goiim,

  <verse number="2" style="v" />that they made war against Bera, king of Sodom, Birsha, king of Gomorrah, Shinab, king of Admah, Shemeber, king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (also called Zoar).

<verse number="3" style="v" />These latter five kings joined together in the valley of Siddim (also called the Salt Sea).

  <verse number="4" style="v" />Twelve years they had served Chedorlaomer, but in the thirteenth year they rebelled.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Then in the fourteenth year, Chedorlaomer and the kings who were with him came and attacked the Rephaim in Ashteroth Karnaim, the Zuzim in Ham, the Emim in Shaveh Kiriathaim,

  <verse number="6" style="v" />and the Horites in their hill country of Seir, as far as El Paran, which is near the desert.

<verse number="7" style="v" />Then they turned and came to En Mishpat (also called Kadesh), and defeated all the country of the Amalekites, and also the Amorites who lived in Hazazon Tamar.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="8" style="v" />Then the king of Sodom, the king of Gomorrah, the king of Admah, the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (also called Zoar) went out and prepared for battle

  <verse number="9" style="v" />against Chedorlaomer, king of Elam, Tidal, king of Goiim, Amraphel, king of Shinar, Arioch, king of Ellasar; four kings against the five.

<verse number="10" style="v" />Now the valley of Siddim was full of tar pits, and as the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah fled, they fell in there. Those who were left fled to the mountains.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />So the enemy took all the goods of Sodom and Gomorrah and all their provisions, and went their way.

  <verse number="12" style="v" />When they went, they also took Lot, Abram's brother's son, who was living in Sodom, along with all his possessions.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="13" style="v" />One who had escaped came and told Abram the Hebrew. He was living by the oaks that belonged to Mamre, the Amorite, who was the brother of Eshcol and Aner, who were all allies of Abram.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />Now when Abram heard that enemies had captured his relative, he led out his three hundred and eighteen trained men, born in his house, and pursued them as far as Dan.

<verse number="15" style="v" />He divided his men against them at night and attacked them, and pursued them as far as Hobah, which is north of Damascus.

  <verse number="16" style="v" />Then he brought back all the possessions, and also brought back his relative Lot and his goods, as well as the women and the other people.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="17" style="v" />After Abram returned from defeating Chedorlaomer and the kings who were with him, the king of Sodom went out to meet him at the valley of Shaveh (also called the King's Valley).

  <verse number="18" style="v" />Melchizedek, king of Salem, brought out bread and wine. He was priest of God Most High.

<verse number="19" style="v" />He blessed him saying, </para>

<para style="q1">"Blessed be Abram by God Most High, Creator of heaven and earth.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="20" style="v" />Blessed be God Most High, who has given your enemies into your hand." Then Abram gave him a tenth of everything.

<verse number="21" style="v" />The king of Sodom said to Abram, "Give me the people, and take the goods for yourself."

<verse number="22" style="v" />Abram said to the king of Sodom, "I have lifted up my hand to Yahweh, God Most High, Creator of heaven and earth,

<verse number="23" style="v" />that I will not take a thread, a sandal strap, or anything that is yours, so that you can never say, 'I have made Abram rich.'

<verse number="24" style="v" />I will take nothing except what the young men have eaten and the share of the men that went with me. Let Aner, Eshcol, and Mamre take their portion."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />After these things the word of Yahweh came to Abram in a vision, saying, "Fear not, Abram! I am your shield and your very great reward."

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Abram said, "Lord Yahweh, what will you give me, since I continue childless, and the heir of my house is Eliezer of Damascus?"

  <verse number="3" style="v" />Abram said, "Since you have given me no descendant, see, the steward of my house is my heir."

<verse number="4" style="v" />Then, behold, the word of Yahweh came to him, saying, "This man will not be your heir; but rather the one who will come from your own body will be your heir."

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Then he brought him outside, and said, "Look toward heaven, and number the stars, if you are able to number them." Then he said to him, "So will your descendants be."

<verse number="6" style="v" />He believed Yahweh, and he counted it to him as righteousness.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />He said to him, "I am Yahweh, who brought you out of Ur of the Chaldeans, to give you this land to inherit it."

  <verse number="8" style="v" />He said, "Lord Yahweh, how will I know that I will inherit it?"

<verse number="9" style="v" />Then he said to him, "Bring me a heifer three years old, a female goat three years old, a ram three years old, a dove, and a young pigeon."

  <verse number="10" style="v" />He brought him all these, and cut them in two, and placed each half opposite the other, but he did not divide the birds.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />When the birds of prey came down upon the carcasses, Abram drove them away.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="12" style="v" />Then when the sun was going down, Abram fell sound asleep and, behold, a deep and terrifying darkness overwhelmed him.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />Then Yahweh said to Abram, "Know for certain that your descendants will be strangers in a land that is not theirs, and will be enslaved and oppressed for four hundred years.

<verse number="14" style="v" />I will judge that nation that they will serve, and afterward they will come out with abundant possessions.

  <verse number="15" style="v" />But you will go to your fathers in peace, and you will be buried in a good old age.

  <verse number="16" style="v" />In the fourth generation they will come here again, for the iniquity of the Amorites has not yet reached its limit."

<verse number="17" style="v" />When the sun had gone down and it was dark, behold, a smoking fire pot and a flaming torch passed between the pieces.

  <verse number="18" style="v" />On that day Yahweh made a covenant with Abram, saying, "To your descendants I hereby give this land, from the river of Egypt to the great river, the Euphrates—

  <verse number="19" style="v" />the Kenites, the Kenizzites, the Kadmonites,

  <verse number="20" style="v" />the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Rephaites,

  <verse number="21" style="v" />the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Girgashites, and the Jebusites."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Now Sarai, Abram's wife, had not borne any children for him, but she had a female servant, an Egyptian, whose name was Hagar.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />So Sarai said to Abram, "See, Yahweh has kept me from having children. Go sleep with my servant. It may be that I will have children by her." Abram listened to the voice of Sarai. 

  <verse number="3" style="v" />It was after Abram had lived ten years in the land of Canaan that Sarai, Abram's wife, gave Hagar, her Egyptian servant, to her husband as a wife.

  <verse number="4" style="v" />So he had relations with Hagar, and she conceived. And when she saw that she had conceived, she looked with contempt on her mistress.

<verse number="5" style="v" />Then Sarai said to Abram, "This wrong on me is because of you. I gave my servant woman into your embrace, and when she saw that she had conceived, I was despised in her eyes. Let Yahweh judge between me and you."

  <verse number="6" style="v" />But Abram said to Sarai, "See here, your servant woman is in your power, do to her what you think best." So Sarai dealt harshly with her, and she fled from her.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="7" style="v" />The angel of Yahweh found her by a spring of water in the wilderness, the spring that is on the way to Shur.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />He said, "Hagar, Sarai's servant, where did you come from and where are you going?" And she said, "I am fleeing from my mistress Sarai."

<verse number="9" style="v" />The angel of Yahweh said to her, "Return to your mistress, and submit yourself to her authority."

  <verse number="10" style="v" />Then the angel of Yahweh said to her, "I will greatly multiply your descendants, so that they will be too numerous to count."

<verse number="11" style="v" />The angel of Yahweh also said to her, </para>

<para style="q1">"Behold, you are pregnant, and will bear a son, and you will call his name Ishmael, </para>

<para style="q1">because Yahweh has heard your affliction.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="12" style="v" />He will be a wild donkey of a man. He will be hostile against every man, and every man will be hostile to him, </para>

<para style="q1">and he will live apart from all his brothers."

<verse number="13" style="v" />Then she gave this name to Yahweh who spoke to her, "You are the God who sees me," for she said, "Do I really continue to see, even after he has seen me?"

<verse number="14" style="v" />Therefore the well was called Beerlahairoi; behold, it is between Kadesh and Bered.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="15" style="v" />Hagar gave birth to Abram's son, and Abram named his son, whom Hagar bore, Ishmael.

  <verse number="16" style="v" />Abram was eighty-six years old when Hagar bore Ishmael to Abram.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />When Abram was ninety-nine years old, Yahweh appeared to Abram and said to him, "I am God Almighty. Walk before me, and be blameless.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Then I will confirm my covenant between me and you, and will multiply you exceedingly."

<verse number="3" style="v" />Abram bowed low with his face to the ground and God talked with him, saying,

  <verse number="4" style="v" />"As for me, behold, my covenant is with you. You will be the father of a multitude of nations.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />No longer will your name be Abram, but your name will be Abraham—for I appoint you to be the father of a multitude of nations.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />I will make you exceedingly fruitful, and I will make nations of you, and kings will descend from you.

<verse number="7" style="v" />I will establish my covenant between me and you and your descendants after you, throughout their generations for an everlasting covenant, to be God to you and to your descendants after you.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />I will give to you, and to your descendants after you, the land where you have been living, all the land of Canaan, for an everlasting possession, and I will be their God."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="9" style="v" />Then God said to Abraham, "As for you, you must keep my covenant, you and your descendants after you throughout their generations.

  <verse number="10" style="v" />This is my covenant, which you must keep, between me and you and your descendants after you: Every male among you must be circumcised.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />You must be circumcised in the flesh of your foreskin, and this will be the sign of the covenant between me and you.

<verse number="12" style="v" />Every male among you that is eight days old must be circumcised, throughout your people's generations. This includes him who is born into your household and him who is bought with money from any foreigner who is not one of your descendants.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />He who is born into your household and he who is bought with your money must be circumcised. Thus my covenant will be in your flesh for an everlasting covenant.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />Any uncircumcised male who is not circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin will be cut off from his people. He has broken my covenant."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="15" style="v" />God said to Abraham, "As for Sarai your wife, do not call her Sarai any more. Instead, her name will be Sarah.

  <verse number="16" style="v" />I will bless her, and I will give you a son by her. I will bless her, and she will become the mother of nations. Kings of peoples will come from her."

<verse number="17" style="v" />Then Abraham bowed low with his face to the ground, and laughed, and said in his heart, "Can a child be born to a man who is a hundred years old? And can Sarah, who is ninety years old, bear a son?"

  <verse number="18" style="v" />Abraham said to God, "Oh that Ishmael might live before you!"

<verse number="19" style="v" />God said, "No, but Sarah your wife will bear you a son, and you must name him Isaac. I will establish my covenant with him as an everlasting covenant with his descendants after him.

  <verse number="20" style="v" />As for Ishmael, I have heard you. Behold, I hereby bless him, and will make him fruitful, and will multiply him abundantly. He will be the father of twelve leaders of tribes, and I will make him become a great nation.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />But my covenant I will establish with Isaac, whom Sarah will bear to you at this time in the next year."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="22" style="v" />When he had finished talking with him, God went up from Abraham.

  <verse number="23" style="v" />Then Abraham took Ishmael his son, and all those who were born into his household, and all those who were bought with his money, every male among the men of Abraham's household, and circumcised the flesh of their foreskin in that same day, as God had said to him.

<verse number="24" style="v" />Abraham was ninety-nine years old when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.

  <verse number="25" style="v" />And Ishmael his son was thirteen years old when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.

  <verse number="26" style="v" />On the very same day Abraham and Ishmael his son were both circumcised.

  <verse number="27" style="v" />All the men of his household were circumcised with him, including those born into the household and those bought with money from a foreigner.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Yahweh appeared to Abraham by the oaks of Mamre, as he sat in the tent doorway in the heat of the day.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />He looked up and, behold, he saw three men standing across from him. When he saw them, he ran to meet them from the tent door and bowed low to the ground.

<verse number="3" style="v" />He said, "Lord, if I have found favor in your sight, do not pass by and leave your servant.

  <verse number="4" style="v" />Let a little water be brought, wash your feet, and rest yourselves under the tree.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Let me bring a little food, so that you may refresh yourselves. Afterwards you can go your way, since you have come to your servant." And they said, "Do as you have said."

<verse number="6" style="v" />Then Abraham quickly went into the tent to Sarah, and said, "Hurry, get three seahs of fine flour, knead it, and make bread."

  <verse number="7" style="v" />Then Abraham ran to the herd, and took a calf that was tender and good, and gave it to the servant, and he hurried to prepare it.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />He took curds and milk, and the calf that had been prepared, and placed the food before them, and he stood by them under the tree while they ate.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="9" style="v" />They said to him, "Where is Sarah your wife?" He replied, "There, in the tent."

  <verse number="10" style="v" />He said, "I will certainly return to you in the springtime, and see, Sarah your wife will have a son." Sarah was listening in the tent doorway, which was behind him.

<verse number="11" style="v" />Now Abraham and Sarah were old, very advanced in age, and Sarah had passed the age when women could bear children.

  <verse number="12" style="v" />So Sarah laughed to herself, saying to herself, "After I have become worn out, will I have this pleasure, my master being old also?"

<verse number="13" style="v" />Yahweh said to Abraham, "Why did Sarah laugh and say, 'Will I really bear a child, when I am old'?

  <verse number="14" style="v" />Is anything too hard for Yahweh? At the time appointed by me, in the spring, I will return to you. About this time next year Sarah will have a son."

  <verse number="15" style="v" />Then Sarah denied it and said, "I did not laugh," for she was afraid. He replied, "No, you did laugh."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="16" style="v" />Then the men arose to leave and looked down toward Sodom. Abraham went with them to see them on their way.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />But Yahweh said, "Should I hide from Abraham what I am about to do,

  <verse number="18" style="v" />since Abraham will indeed become a great and mighty nation, and all the nations of the earth will be blessed in him?

  <verse number="19" style="v" />For I have chosen him so that he may instruct his children and his household after him to keep the way of Yahweh, to do righteousness and justice, so that Yahweh may bring upon Abraham what he has said to him."

<verse number="20" style="v" />Then Yahweh said, "Because the outcry against Sodom and Gomorrah is so great, and because their sin is so serious,

  <verse number="21" style="v" />I will now go down there and see the outcry against her that has come to me, whether they have really done it. If not, I will know."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="22" style="v" />So the men turned from there, and went toward Sodom, but Abraham remained standing before Yahweh.

  <verse number="23" style="v" />Then Abraham approached and said, "Will you sweep away the righteous with the wicked?

<verse number="24" style="v" />Perhaps there are fifty righteous within the city. Will you sweep it away and not spare the place for the sake of the fifty righteous that are there?

  <verse number="25" style="v" />Far be it from you to do such a thing, killing the righteous with the wicked, so that the righteous should be treated the same as the wicked. Far be it from you! Will not the Judge of all the earth do what is just?"

  <verse number="26" style="v" />Yahweh said, "If I find in Sodom fifty righteous within the city, then I will spare the whole place for their sake."

<verse number="27" style="v" />Abraham answered and said, "Look, I have undertaken to speak to my Lord, even though I am only dust and ashes!

  <verse number="28" style="v" />What if there are five less than fifty righteous? Will you destroy the whole city for lack of five?" And he said, "I will not destroy it, if I find there forty-five."

<verse number="29" style="v" />He spoke to him yet again, and said, "What if there are forty found there?" He replied, "I will not do it for the forty's sake."

  <verse number="30" style="v" />He said, "Please do not be angry, Lord, so I may speak. Perhaps thirty will be found there." He replied, "I will not do it, if I find thirty there."

  <verse number="31" style="v" />He said, "Look, I have undertaken to speak to my Lord! Perhaps twenty will be found there." He replied, "I will not destroy it for the twenty's sake."

<verse number="32" style="v" />He said, "Please do not be angry, Lord, and I will speak this one last time. Perhaps ten will be found there." And he said, "I will not destroy it for the ten's sake."

  <verse number="33" style="v" />Yahweh went on his way as soon as he had finished talking with Abraham, and Abraham returned home.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />The two angels came to Sodom in the evening, while Lot was sitting at the gate of Sodom. Lot saw them, arose to meet them, and bowed down with his face to the ground.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />He said, "Please my masters, I urge you to turn aside into your servant's house, stay for the night, and wash your feet. Then you can rise up early and go on your way." And they said, "No, we will spend the night in the town square."

  <verse number="3" style="v" />But he urged them strongly, so they went with him, and entered into his house. He prepared a meal and baked unleavened bread, and they ate.

<verse number="4" style="v" />But before they lay down, the men of the city, the men of Sodom, surrounded the house, both young and old, all the men from every part of the city.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />They called to Lot, and said to him, "Where are the men that came in to you tonight? Bring them out to us, that we may sleep with them."

<verse number="6" style="v" />So Lot went out the door to them and shut the door after himself.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />He said, "I beg you, my brothers, do not act so wickedly.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />Look, I have two daughters who have not slept with any man. Let me, I beg you, bring them out to you, and you do to them whatever is good in your eyes. Only do nothing to these men, because they have come under the shadow of my roof."

<verse number="9" style="v" />They said, "Stand back!" They also said, "This one came here to live as a foreigner, and now he has become our judge! Now we will deal worse with you than with them." They pressed hard against the man, against Lot, and came near to break down the door.

<verse number="10" style="v" />But the men reached out their hands and brought Lot into the house with them and shut the door.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />As for the men who were outside the door of the house, Lot's visitors attacked them with blindness, both young and old, so that they wore themselves out trying to find the door.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="12" style="v" />Then the men said to Lot, "Do you have anyone else here? Any sons-in-law, your sons and your daughters, and whoever you have in the city, get them out of here.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />For we are about to destroy this place, because the accusations against it before Yahweh have become so loud that he has sent us to destroy it."

<verse number="14" style="v" />Lot went out and spoke to his sons-in-law, the men who had promised to marry his daughters, and said, "Quick, get out of this place, for Yahweh is about to destroy the city." But to his sons-in-law he seemed to be joking.

  <verse number="15" style="v" />When the morning dawned, the angels urged Lot, saying, "Get going, take your wife and your two daughters that are here, so you are not swept away in the punishment of the city."

<verse number="16" style="v" />But he lingered. So the men grabbed his hand, and the hand of his wife, and the hands of his two daughters, because Yahweh was merciful to him. They brought them out, and set them outside the city.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />When they had brought them out, one of the men said, "Run for your lives! Do not look back, or stay anywhere on the plain. Escape to the mountains so you are not swept away."

<verse number="18" style="v" />Lot said to them, "No, please, my masters!

  <verse number="19" style="v" />Your servant has found favor in your sight, and you have shown me great kindness in saving my life, but I cannot escape to the mountains, because the disaster will overtake me, and I will die.

  <verse number="20" style="v" />Look, that city over there is near enough to flee to, and it is a little one. Please, let me escape there (is it not a little one?), and my life will be saved."

<verse number="21" style="v" />He said to him, "Alright, I am granting this request also, that I will not destroy the city which you have mentioned.

  <verse number="22" style="v" />Hurry! Escape there, for I cannot do anything until you arrive there." Therefore the city was called Zoar.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="23" style="v" />The sun had risen upon the earth when Lot reached Zoar.

  <verse number="24" style="v" />Then Yahweh rained down upon Sodom and Gomorrah sulfur and fire from Yahweh out of the sky.

  <verse number="25" style="v" />He destroyed those cities, and all the plain, and all the inhabitants of the cities, and the plants that grew on the ground.

<verse number="26" style="v" />But Lot's wife, who was behind him, looked back, and she became a pillar of salt.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="27" style="v" />Abraham got up early in the morning and went to the place where he had stood before Yahweh.

  <verse number="28" style="v" />He looked down toward Sodom and Gomorrah and toward all the land of the plain. He looked and behold, smoke was rising from the land like the smoke of a furnace.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="29" style="v" />So when God destroyed the cities of the plain, God called Abraham to mind. He sent Lot out of the midst of the destruction when he destroyed the cities in which Lot had lived.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="30" style="v" />But Lot went up from Zoar to live in the mountains with his two daughters, because he was afraid to live in Zoar. So he lived in a cave, he and his two daughters.

<verse number="31" style="v" />The firstborn said to the younger, "Our father is old, and there is no man anywhere to sleep with us according to the way of all the world.

  <verse number="32" style="v" />Come, let us make our father drink wine, and we will sleep with him, so that we may extend our father's line."

  <verse number="33" style="v" />So they made their father drink wine that night. Then the firstborn went in and slept with her father; he did not know when she lay down, nor when she arose.

<verse number="34" style="v" />The next day the firstborn said to the younger, "Listen, last night I slept with my father. Let us make him drink wine tonight also, and you should go in and sleep with him, so that we may extend our father's line."

  <verse number="35" style="v" />So they made their father drink wine that night also, and the younger went and slept with him. He did not know when she lay down, nor when she arose.

<verse number="36" style="v" />So both the daughters of Lot were pregnant by their father.

  <verse number="37" style="v" />The firstborn gave birth to a son, and named him Moab. He became the ancestor of the Moabites of today.
