<para style="q1">For in their anger they killed men. It was for pleasure that they hamstrung oxen.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="7" style="v" />May their anger be cursed, for it was fierce—and their fury, for it was cruel.</para>

<para style="q1">I will divide them in Jacob and scatter them in Israel.</para>

<para style="q2">

<verse number="8" style="v" />Judah, your brothers will praise you. Your hand will be on the neck of your enemies.</para>

<para style="q1">Your father's sons will bow down before you.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="9" style="v" />Judah is a lion's cub. My son, you have gone up from your victims.</para>

<para style="q1">He stooped down, he crouched like a lion, like a lioness. Who would dare to awaken him?</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="10" style="v" />The scepter will not depart from Judah, nor the ruler's staff from between his feet,</para>

<para style="q1">until Shiloh comes. The nations will obey him.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="11" style="v" />Binding his young horse to the vine, and his donkey's colt to the choice vine,</para>

<para style="q1">he has washed his garments in wine, and his robe in the blood of grapes.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="12" style="v" />His eyes will be as dark as wine, and his teeth as white as milk.</para>

<para style="q2">

<verse number="13" style="v" />Zebulun will live by the shore of the sea. He will be a harbor for ships,</para>

<para style="q1">and his border will extend to Sidon.</para>

<para style="q2">

<verse number="14" style="v" />Issachar is a strong donkey, lying down between the sheepfolds.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="15" style="v" />He sees a good resting place and the pleasant land.</para>

<para style="q1">He will bend his shoulder to the burden and became a servant for the task.</para>

<para style="q2">

<verse number="16" style="v" />Dan will judge his people as one of the tribes of Israel.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="17" style="v" />Dan will be a snake beside the road, a poisonous snake in the path</para>

<para style="q1">that bites the horse's heels, so that his rider falls backward.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="18" style="v" />I wait for your salvation, Yahweh.</para>

<para style="q2">

<verse number="19" style="v" />Gad—raiders will attack him, but he will attack them at their heels.</para>

<para style="q2">

<verse number="20" style="v" />Asher's food will be rich, and he will provide royal delicacies.</para>

<para style="q2">

<verse number="21" style="v" />Naphtali is a doe let loose; he will have beautiful fawns.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="22" style="v" />Joseph is a fruitful bough, a fruitful bough near a spring,</para>

<para style="q1">whose branches climb over the wall.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="23" style="v" />The archers will attack him and shoot at him and harass him.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="24" style="v" />But his bow will remain steady, and his hands will be skillful</para>

<para style="q1">because of the hands of the Mighty One of Jacob, because of the name of the Shepherd, the Rock of Israel.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="25" style="v" />Because the God of your father, who will help you, and because of the Almighty God, who will bless you</para>

<para style="q1">with blessings of the sky above, blessings of the deep that lies beneath,</para>

<para style="q1">blessings of the breasts and womb.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="26" style="v" />The blessings of your father will be greater than of the ancient mountains</para>

<para style="q1">or of the desirable things of the everlasting hills.</para>

<para style="q1">They will be on the head of Joseph, blessings that crown the head of the one who was prince over his brothers.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="27" style="v" />Benjamin is a hungry wolf. In the morning he will devour the prey,</para>

<para style="q1">and in the evening he will divide the plunder."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="28" style="v" />These are the twelve tribes of Israel. This is it what their father said to them when he blessed them. Each one he blessed with an appropriate blessing.

  <verse number="29" style="v" />Then he instructed them and said to them, "I am about to go to my people. Bury me with my forefathers in the cave that is in the field of Ephron the Hittite,

  <verse number="30" style="v" />in the cave that is in the field of Machpelah, which is near Mamre in the land of Canaan, the field that Abraham bought for a burial place from Ephron the Hittite.

<verse number="31" style="v" />There they buried Abraham and Sarah his wife; there they buried Isaac and Rebekah his wife; and there I buried Leah.

  <verse number="32" style="v" />The field and the cave that is in it were purchased from the people of Heth."

  <verse number="33" style="v" />When Jacob finished these instructions to his sons, he pulled his feet into the bed, breathed his last, and went to his people.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Then Joseph was so distressed that he collapsed on the face of his father, and he wept over him, and he kissed him.  

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Joseph commanded his servants the physicians to embalm his father. So the physicians embalmed Israel.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />They took forty days, for that was the full time for embalming. The Egyptians wept for him seventy days.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="4" style="v" />When the days of weeping were over, Joseph spoke to Pharaoh's royal court saying, "If now I have found favor in your eyes, please speak to Pharaoh, saying,

  <verse number="5" style="v" />'My father made me swear, saying, "See, I am about to die. Bury me in my tomb that I dug for myself in the land of Canaan. There you will bury me." Now let me go up and bury my father, and then I will return.'"

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Pharaoh answered, "Go and bury your father, as he made you swear."

<verse number="7" style="v" />Joseph went up to bury his father. With him went up all the officials of Pharaoh, the courtiers of his household, and all the senior officials of the land of Egypt,

  <verse number="8" style="v" />with all Joseph's household and his brothers, and his father's household. But they left their little ones, their flocks, and their herds, in the land of Goshen.

  <verse number="9" style="v" />Chariots and horsemen also went with him. It was a very large group of people.

<verse number="10" style="v" />When they came to the threshing floor of Atad on the other side of the Jordan, they mourned with very great and grievous sorrow. There Joseph made a seven day mourning for his father.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />When the inhabitants of the land, the Canaanites, saw the mourning in the floor of Atad, they said, "This is a very sad occasion for the Egyptians." That is why the place was called Abel Mizraim, which is beyond the Jordan.

<verse number="12" style="v" />So his sons did for Jacob just as he had instructed them.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />His sons carried him to the land of Canaan and buried him in the cave in the field of Machpelah, near Mamre. Abraham had bought the cave with the field for a burial place. He had bought it from Ephron the Hittite.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />After he had buried his father, Joseph returned into Egypt, he, along with his brothers, and all who had accompanied him to bury his father.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="15" style="v" />When Joseph's brothers saw that their father was dead, they said, "What if Joseph bears a grudge and wants to repay us in full for all the evil we did to him?"

  <verse number="16" style="v" />So they commanded the presence of Joseph, saying, "Your father gave instructions before he died, saying,

  <verse number="17" style="v" />'Tell Joseph this, "Please forgive the transgression of your brothers and their sin when they did evil to you."' Now please forgive the servants of the God of your father." Joseph wept when they spoke to him.

<verse number="18" style="v" />His brothers also went and lay facedown before him. They said, "See, we are your servants."

  <verse number="19" style="v" />But Joseph answered them, "Do not be afraid. Am I in the place of God?

  <verse number="20" style="v" />And as for you, you meant to harm me, but God meant it for good, to preserve the lives of many people, as you see today.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />So now do not be afraid. I will provide for you and your little children." He comforted them in this way and spoke kindly to them.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="22" style="v" />Joseph lived in Egypt, together with his father's family. He lived one hundred ten years.

  <verse number="23" style="v" />Joseph saw Ephraim's children to the third generation. He also saw the children of Machir son of Manasseh. They were "born on his knees."

<verse number="24" style="v" />Joseph said to his brothers, "I am about to die; but God will surely come to you and lead you up out of this land to the land which he swore to give to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob."

  <verse number="25" style="v" />Then Joseph made the people of Israel swear an oath. He said, "God will surely come to you. At that time you must carry up my bones from here."

  <verse number="26" style="v" />So Joseph died, 110 years old. They embalmed him and he was placed in a coffin in Egypt.</para>
